question: Let V be a finite-dimensional vector space and T: V -> V a linear operator. Prove or disprove: If all eigenvalues of T have absolute value less than 1, then T^n -> 0 as n -> infinity (operator convergence).
Compute the fundamental group pi_1(S^1 v S^1), where v denotes the wedge sum of topological spaces.
Solve the PDE u_t = u_{xx} on (0, pi) x (0, infinity) with boundary conditions u(0,t)=0, u(pi,t)=0 and initial condition u(x,0)=x(pi-x).
Let (X, F, mu) be a measure space and f_n -> f almost everywhere with |f_n| <= g for an integrable function g. State and justify the theorem that guarantees integral f_n -> integral f.
Evaluate the integral over R of e^{-x^2} cos(ax) dx for a real parameter a.
Show that the series sum_{n=2}^infinity 1/(n (ln n)^p) converges if and only if p > 1.
Given a compact Riemannian manifold (M,g), show that the Laplace-Beltrami operator Delta has a discrete spectrum with eigenvalues 0 <= lambda_1 <= lambda_2 <= ... -> infinity.
Let G be a finite group acting on a set X. Prove Burnside's lemma for counting orbits: |X/G| = (1/|G|) sum_{g in G} |Fix(g)|.
Show that every bounded sequence in R^n has a convergent subsequence.
In C (complex numbers), determine all analytic functions f such that |f(z)| = |z| for all z.
